trans-unit.source: Provides guides for porting your existing games to Direct3D 11, Universal Windows Platform (UWP), and Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Provides guides for porting your existing games to Direct3D 11, Universal Windows Platform (UWP), and Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Provides guides for porting your existing games to Direct3D 11, Universal Windows Platform (UWP), and Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Provides guides for porting your existing games to Direct3D 11, Universal Windows Platform (UWP), and Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Port from DirectX 9 to Universal Windows Platform
trans-unit.target: Port from DirectX 9 to Universal Windows Platform

trans-unit.source: This section includes articles, overviews, and walkthroughs for porting DirectX 9 games to UWP.
trans-unit.target: This section includes articles, overviews, and walkthroughs for porting DirectX 9 games to UWP.

trans-unit.source: Port from OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11.1
trans-unit.target: Port from OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11.1

trans-unit.source: Includes articles, overviews, and walkthroughs for porting an OpenGL ES 2.0 graphics pipeline to a Direct3D 11 and the Windows Runtime.
trans-unit.target: Includes articles, overviews, and walkthroughs for porting an OpenGL ES 2.0 graphics pipeline to a Direct3D 11 and the Windows Runtime.

trans-unit.source: **Note** This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
trans-unit.target: **Note** This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

trans-unit.source: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the [archived documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132).
trans-unit.target: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the [archived documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132).
